reasoning: The test requires that the AD Authentication provider be registered and enabled in DNN's authentication settings as a precondition, but this configuration step was never performed. The module files are deployed but the provider is not activated - this is expected behavior, not a bug.
evidence_summary: Screenshot shows a standard DNN login page with username/password fields but no Windows/AD authentication tab. The test observations confirm module files are deployed and WindowsSignin.aspx exists and is configured correctly, but the provider is simply not registered as an active authentication system - a required administrative configuration step that was not performed during test setup.
scenario_id: DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication::Windows Single Sign-On (SSO)::Windows Login Tab Presence on Login Page
